abstract: Ask.com releases Ask Deals, a service aimed at helping consumers find discounts on products.
snippet: Ask.com releases Ask Deals, a service aimed at helping consumers find discounts on products.
lead_paragraph: Ask.com, a perennial niche player in Internet search, is making another attempt at staying relevant in a market that is dominated by giants like Google.

headline.main: In a Down Economy, Ask.com Bets on Coupons

abstract: A Web start-up led by a former Google executive plans to generate personalized health plans.
snippet: A Web start-up led by a former Google executive plans to generate personalized health plans.
lead_paragraph: The national health care debate right now is all about giving more people affordable access to doctors and hospitals. Yet the vast majority of health care decisions  80 percent or more, experts say  are really made by individuals, instead of medical professionals, whether choices are about diet and exercise or ways of managing chronic conditions like diabetes and heart disease.

headline.main: Adding Health Advice to Online Medical Records
headline.print_headline: A Web Site Devoted to Your Health

abstract: Google now has support for Android on all the major wireless carriers in the United States, except AT&T, the home of the iPhone.
snippet: Google now has support for Android on all the major wireless carriers in the United States, except AT&T, the home of the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: A year after Google introduced its Android operating system on T-Mobile, the smallest of the major wireless carriers in the United States, it announced a deal to offer handsets with Verizon Wireless, the nation’s largest carrier.

abstract: A pair of start-ups hope to woo companies like Google and Facebook with servers that rely on chips typically found in phones and mobile computing devices.
snippet: A pair of start-ups hope to woo companies like Google and Facebook with servers that rely on chips typically found in phones and mobile computing devices.
lead_paragraph: If a server runs on a smartphone chip is it still a server?

headline.main: Servers With Cellphone Chips? Yep, Here They Come

abstract: Google and Verizon plan to make Android handsets and other devices that do things on Verizon’s network that Android phones on other networks can’t do.
snippet: Google and Verizon plan to make Android handsets and other devices that do things on Verizon’s network that Android phones on other networks can’t do.
lead_paragraph: Being open doesn’t mean being ordinary, at least in the construction of Lowell C. McAdam, the chief executive of Verizon Wireless.

headline.main: Verizon O.K. With Competition From Android Apps
